Reviews.Title: “Excellent ...will stay there every time”
Reviews.Author: KMLTRADING
Reviews.Content: What can i say there are so many overpriced hotels in Dubai but this place is great value. Staff absolutely superb, friendly and helpful and it felt genuine rather than forced ..you know these things if you travel a lot. Great location you can hit the creek old town etc by walking. Shuttle to the beach, a pub with Guiness and ale that has english premiership games on , they even arranged it so my team won ! ! what more do you want ? Nice pool area with enough sun. Hotel in general feels quiet and peaceful but certainly not dead. In fact lively area with superb supermarket next door for your papers , take away curry and more. I pass through Dubai in transit so often and I have tried others but this place makes you want to stay over and is the best value by a long way. EXCELLENT

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: nphil4
Reviews.Content: After an apalling stay at "Marco Polo" (advertised as a 4*) hotel a few weeks prior, I entered this hotel with some anxiety. I could not have envisaged the warm welcome I received. Just what was needed after a very long flight. This friendly attitude was consistently displayed from reception staff, gym staff, to room attendants and the trainee porter. They didn't miss a beat. Especially Kieth on reception and Victoria in the Brasserie!! Food was great; rooms very clean with comfy beds and pillows. I was upgraded to an Executive suite, so can only comment on that room. I assume that other rooms would be of similar standard. The swimming pool area is well maintained with water at a delightful temperature. Taxis were plentiful and cheap by Aussie standards, so Dubai tourist spots easy to access. Hope the management places these positve comments on a staff notice board. Everybody needs to be appreciated. Life is tough for many of them and a pat on the back would make their day.. Con: Lobby internet charges are too dear, expecially if you want to use it for say 15 mins. $9.00 AU (approx) for up to 1 hour. How about 15 mins free, 30 mins $5. And put instructions for use near computer. Save trying to get help if reception is busy e.g. username = room number etc etc. Get rid of ugly flowers on small table near front window in Lobby snack area. Put some 4/5 star 'real' flowers or an upmarket/designer artificial arrangement on reception counter to brighten up the entrance. Nothing cheap and tacky!!

Reviews.Title: “Flawless stay”
Reviews.Author: Devansh88
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive about the stay here after reading some of the feedbacks on this website but was pleasantly surprised on check-in and during the stay. Staff here in one of the most courteous and friendly I've come across. Location was excellent. Heart of Bur Dubai and a 5 min. walk from the metro station on either side. Loads of eateries around and most of the things are not far away either. The front office staff made us felt welcomed and check-in was really quick. Rooms were excellent. The bathroom was clean and tidy but the only thing missing was personal amenities like toothbrush and toothpaste. The only downside was internet was chargeable, breakfast a bit expensive and airport transfers not included but I could live with it. Excellent place to stay if you want to be close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madey00
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times this hotel, it is great value hotel. Awesome staff with great service. I In addition is convenient hotel, closer to the metro as well as a near by mall. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: HappyTimes2011
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very spacious and modern in their design. The English pub serves savory meals in a pleasant atmosphere. Everyone of the hotel staff I interacted with was pleasant and helpful. This is a very convenient hotel if you want a good place to crash after a long day or night. To make your stay pleasant, make sure you coordinate with the concierge in advance to have a taxi ready for you. The two metro stations nearby are quite convenient. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nandan_Shah
Reviews.Content: We are from Mumbai & recently stayed in this hotel for 7 nights with family. The rooms are clean and neatly kept. Entire hotel is impeccably clean & neat. Fine dining is available in its restaurants. Coffee shop offers great breakfast. Room service is great. Wi-fi connectivity is free in lobby but has connectivity issues once in a while. Entire staff is helpful. Special mention to Ahmed Ezzat who can guide finely for shopping/tours. Hotlel is conveniently located to all restaurants/burjuman mall, metros, meena bazaar & highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Cleanliness is great here. Excellent bar & lobby and elevators. Room air conditioning was terrific. Bathrooms are very clean & tidy. Nandan Shah & Family.

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: oanapaskoviti
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 3 days!perfect room,very clean,near to center!the concierge named AHMED helped us with all the trips and excursions we wanted to make!perfect guy!and the receptionist (KEITH)very friendly and helpful!!we were compreltelly satisfied!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Convenience in Bur Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Chris60Yass
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as our first stop on a ten week trip to Europe in April 2011. We found it very welcoming after a long flight from Australia, and were delighted that our early morning arrival was anticipated and our room ready quite quickly. The service and friendliness of the staff was excellent and the comfort and cleanliness of the room was appreciated. We also found this a great location for easy sightseeing and safe walking. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Rahul M
Reviews.Content: I was very much pleased with there excellent customer service. Check in was very smooth and was very much pleased with the positive attitude of the front desk.They have the best team of staff. Large rooms, good decor, good location closer to metro station. Breakfast if not included in your room rate its expensive at 70 dh. Indian restuarent with live musics is ideal place for spending evening. Wifi is complimentary in hotel lobby and chargeable in the room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Stan t
Reviews.Content: Spend 3 nights here with my family. Check in was very smooth, particularly by the 2 young indian staff, the best was Keith, spoke very well, new his job and really made you feel welcome. The rooms are ample for people who are looking for simple rooms and will be traveling most of the time in Dubai. There are better rooms, but for the price we had no complaints. We chose this hotel for the close proximity to the embassies/consulates in which i had to use. Even though we were in the heart of Bur Dubai the rooms were sound proof enough not to hear any traffic. We didn't use any dining option apart from the b/fast. The b/fast was superb. Great choices for the food and the star of the show was the restaurant manager, miss VIctoria, i think from Russia. She really drives the morning team with her bubbly friendly personality. The chefs were great also. The junior sous chef was continually checking the buffet and standing in to assist the busy egg station. It might of been nice if they had a bit of support from the waiters when the egg station got busy and taken some written orders. And with the lack of pork i found everything i needed on the morning spread. The lobby wifi was great and very fast for our needs. MIght be nice to give it free in the rooms. The housekeeping staff were great also, gave us extra bottles of water for the babies needs and brought the baby bed in minutes. There is a small pool we saw from the window but the days we were there were not to warm enough to use it. Would i go back to the 4 points in Bur Dubai. Yes and thats because of the staff there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, big room, good service, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Anne M
Reviews.Content: We went there for one week in the beginning of february. The room was nice and quite big. The bed was wonderful and the service exellent. The pool area was a little bit small and in beginning of februar not very sunny. We had sun 2-3 hours from 10.30-13.30 because of the high building close by. It was better the last days, but we rather went some days to the beach. The towels at the pool area was only 3 star, a bit tired:) Internett for free in the resepsjon area, sofa to relax and surf and free parking inside. We loved our stay, and we woluld love to come back sometimes. it was a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fit my criteria for a hotel perfectly”
Reviews.Author: Kansman
Reviews.Content: Criteria- reasonably priced hotel located not too far from the fully booked hotel my mates were staying at, hopefully decent shower, barheoom, bed, room safety as most of my time would be spent away from my room - basically to be used for sleeping and bathing. This exceeded my criteria, plenty staff, all very polite and freindly ( does help uf your polite to them too) - bellhop saw me take money out for a tip but he went before i could tip him (new experience for me!). I also asked for an extra clean towel and no probs there. Room was good enough, no more or less than expected - fruit basket was a nice touch. Carpet did seem unclean but bed was ultra comfy. Good bar, top indian restaurant, brekkie enough choice to start day. Location perfect - near metro etc Only glitch was the coffee maker and tv wasnt working on my last morning. Didnt come to watch tv ( though like it on when im washing / dressing etc), was offered a coffee straight away, so no major problems here. Would stay here again as there was not one member of staff that was unhelpful or rude - they were very nice from the moment my taxi pulled up. Things can be unperfect at hotels but knowing staff are helpful and polite means theyll try and sort out any problems that may and can occur. I got what i wanted from my stay and more. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant, comfy hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: HGA25
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and well furnished with all you would expect. though we only got 2 towels between us, as well as 2 teabags, which I thought was a bit mean. Also, the floor obviously hadn't been hoovered in a while. Apart from that we were pleased with the room. The main problem with this hotel was that they didn't have enough staff. When we arrived there was only 1 person to be found anywhere and he was on reception, swamped. Same story when we checked out. Later, we waited ages in the lobby cafe because the 1 member of staff was run off his feet making coffees and carrying them up to the rooms himself! The Indian restaurant, however, was magnificent. The food was delicious and cooked to perfection and the service was excellent - they had plenty of staff. As well as that, there were 2 really good musicians playing traditional Indian music while we ate. I would visit this restaurant again but I wouldn't stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't care less”
Reviews.Author: madaboutwine
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 1.30 am. The travel agent had prepaid the hotel accommodation so they knew exactly when we were arriving. We had arranged a triple room. When we were shown to our room nothing had been done. It was a large room, with a double bed and nothing else. There were 2 sets of towels only, and two of everything else. We had to then call the front desk and ask them to arrange to make up the room. After about 10 minutes someone came upstairs and moved a big armchair and brought in a single bed. We requested that the chair be removed and we were told it was not possible. We called the duty manager who then agreed to remove the chair. By now it was more than an hour after we had arrived. We were tired and more than a bit angry. We requested extra cups, towels etc. which were brought to the room about 10 minutes later, No additional bottled water was brought up either. The next day, once the room had been made up we were back to 2 cups only and had to request additional cups again. The breakfast room is very small and we were told one mornng that we should sit in the lobby and have breakfast which is totally unacceptable. After a wait of about 10 minutes we were given a table. The wifi in the lobby area was sporadic at best. It kept having to be reset and logging on was a real problem. Everything seemed to be just too much trouble for the staff. In all my travels I have never come across such a couldn't care less attitude. At the price they charge for the rooms one would expect better service.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ShadyHany
Reviews.Content: As a start, I was fully satisfied from my stay in the hotel, we were 2 couples and we spent a week there during new years celebrations. I will share my experience, too many positive things and few negative things that made me not giving it 5 out of 5: First of all the hotel's location is just great, it's in Khalid Ibn Al-Waleed Road, less than 2 minutes walk to a metro station, around 5 minutes walk to Burjuman Mall, around 10 - 15 minutes driving to Airport, Dubai Mall, and Deira City Centre, so location was very good for us however Khalid Ibn Al-Waleed road is always too busy which was maybe because of the high season we travelled at. The hotel offered us free parking for our rented car which was great as well. As the hotel is located in the center of the city, you can find a big supermarket and 2 pharmacies plus many small shops just downstairs, which was more than convenient for us. The hotel staff were perfect, very helpful and always had a smile, just had 1 strange incident with a receptionist that I was coming late at night with my wife and my friend's wife and the receptionist asked me if the ladies had already checked in with us or not! That was our 4th day so I have assumed that the staff had already recognized us, but anyway I just told him the rooms' numbers and that's it. But overall I was pleased to deal with the staff especially the Egyptian conceirage guy Ahmed and 2 Indian bellman guys and the guys of the room service, they were very helpful. Checking in and out took us only minutes, so that was seamless experience for us thanks to the staff. Going to the rooms, they were very spacious and comfortable, beds and pillows guranteed us a deep sleep after hectic shopping days, rooms were cleaned daily and always kept tidy, toilets were great and I enjoyed the rain shower. Also they offer tea & coffee complimentry facility, that was nice to me. Coming to the negative points, lighting in the rooms is extremely low; just a couple of spots and 2 low light bed lights, they need to have a strong lighting in the rooms. That really made my wife suffer each time she was dressing to go out. Another negative thing is the toileteers, they only include shampoo, conditioner and soad, they do not have shower gel so we had to get one from the supermarket downstairs, final thing they don't have bath robes in the rooms. For me if they just solved the lighting problem in the rooms I would definitely give them 5 out of 5. Overall I enjoyed my stay there and would recommend this hotel. I'm not very into Indian food so I haven't tried that restaurant in the hotel, so I can not judge the food there. My friend tried the gym once but he wasn't very satisfied from it, he said it was too small and only filled with trademills, but for me that didn't matter as I usually don't use the gyms in any vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: rosemaryCapeTown
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton hotel in November 2011 for 4 nights. Our room was very luxurious; everything was beautiful and tastefully decorated. The bathroom also very modern and had a window which looked into the bedroom. They provided a voucher for a complementary fruit basket, which we took up a couple of days later. This was a very nice touch. The bed was VERY comfortable and the crisp cotton linen was appreciated. We could however hear music from the hotel functions but still had a good nights rest. The breakfast was varied, catering for eastern and western tastes. The breakfast staff were excellent, helpful and friendly. The hotel is located in the banking district, between two of the new metro stops which are about 10 minutes walk to either station (up or down the road). We purchased a day card for the metro which worked out to be very reasonable and took us to the large shopping malls (Emirates Mall and Mall Dubai). We went in the winter with an average temperature of 24 degrees but this might be a very long walk in mid summer. We booked a buffet dinner trip on the creek at the desk in the lobby which was awful. Not really the hotel’s fault but be warned. We also booked an Arabian Adventures desert safari which was very enjoyable and well organized. We did not dine at the hotel or use the pool facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Solid value for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: Brian W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night after a subpar 2 night stay at the Sheraton Dubai Creek. Overall had a great stay here. In fact wish we had stayed here for our entire stay in Dubai. - Room was a bit small, but stylish, modern and functional - Great breakfast included based on my Platinum status - Very helpful and friendly front desk staff - Convenient location with easy access to metro, mall, and supermarkets Granted it's not one of the "5-star" beack resorts, but if you're here for sightseeing it's a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously lacking in many respects...”
Reviews.Author: cbellman1830
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Four Points - Bur Dubai in November 2011 while attending a course with a major European training institute which was being held at the property. As a frequent visitor to Dubai, and having stayed at several (and patronized many) hotels in Dubai, I was very disappointed in this property. One would not expect five star service or amenities at a simple hotel, but surely they should have a strong focus on their target market and strive to succeed at what they do. Firstly, the course which I attended was very poorly managed by the hotel. Apparently they had booked too many functions for their capacity and ended up trying to squeeze a group of 16 into a tiny converted hotel room which they tried to pass off as a meeting room which would surely not be comfortable for a group of more than 8. They were shockingly unhelpful in this regard and seemed genuinely unprepared to handle such an eventuality. Eventually, our group was transferred to a room which was larger, but was on the ground floor, attached to the hotel bar, had no windows, and smelled very much like throngs of people had been smoking and drinking there all night... hardly an ideal venue for a course. Other than the bungling of the course management, the rooms are underwhelming, the location is a drag (as it takes 15+ minutes in a taxi just to get out of the dingy Bur Dubai neighborhood), and the hotel food offerings are frankly terrible. I will say however, the majority of the hotel staff were friendly and seemed to genuinely care. Still, a friendly staff does not a decent hotel make. Travelers to Dubai are blessed with abundant choice when it comes to hotel selection. There is ample selection for every budget and intention. My advice? Take advantage of the choice and stay somewhere other than the Sheraton Four Points Bur Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location, Above Average Service”
Reviews.Author: reli01
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few times in the very recent past and found this hotel to be one of the best in its category in Bur Dubai. You cannot get another property like this one in so called "Bank Street" area. It's so convenient if you have work in Bur Dubai or adjacent places. Secondly, rooms are all nicely renovated with all the works expected of a 4 star hotel. Breakfast spread is adequate and reception was efficient during both check-in and check-out. Dubai Metro system is just 5 minutes walk and taxis are widely available throughout the day. What else one needs when out on business. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: Winson796
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. I had an executive room which was more than adequate. The staff were very polite and very helpful. The room service was excellent and I enjoyed the food too. All in all a very comfortable stay and I can recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A CITY HOTEL THAT IS REALLY NICE TO STAY IN”
Reviews.Author: HOTEL-CALIFORNIA-101
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few months back, then by mistake booked the Downtown Four Points Sheraton, which is a horrible hotel ( for me anyway ), that was a typical tour type city hotel with no character and matching staff. So this time I made sure to come back to Bur Dubai. Again I found it a really nice hotel, not just because of the furnishings, but also the staff were really friendly and helpful. But first a little word of warning. I booked via hotels.com, no problem, there but when I arrived, I was immediately encouraged to upgrade for DHS 150/day to include breakfast, internet, better room and free bar drinks. The bar drinks turned out to be one token a day, the internet, I am pretty sure was already included and although the room was very nice, I am sure that a lower grade room would have been just as nice. Plus the comparison that was given for the daily charge for internet was not a true comparison, because it is lower per day if you there for several days. And that is assuming that I had not already booked including internet. That aside, I found the rooms excellent and the staff very very friendly and helpful. They always had a smile on their faces - special mention to Mercy in the Promenade restaurant and also Persis on the reception desk. Both of whom were really great. I did have the BBQ on several nights again in the Promenade. Actually what was a pity was that it was very quiet. There is a chef there by the name of Debakar who really makes you feel welcome. This was not like the normal bland hotel buffet he really does care about the guests. I saw him happily greeting some and showing them round what was on offer on several occasions. There is also live music. The last night, I felt quite sorry for him. The food was really good, the BBQ was very very nice but there were not many people around. So if you want a really good welcome and a very nice meal, before Debakar moves on, which I am sure he will. The man is bursting with personality. Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotpedro51
Reviews.Content: Hotel near the new green metro line, just under 2 min walk. Not keen on Bur Dubai area. Pool does get any sun in the winter, English bar is great and good offer at lunch time and great staff. Concierge should know more about Dubai, but they are helpfully. Overal great service is very good, Good rooms, just one thing, executive rooms should have sleepers and bath robs.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room, Great Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueen2002
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the old part of Dubai right between metro stops for both of Dubai's metro lines. The red line is approximately two blocks away and the green line is one block away. The hotel is also within walking distance of the Dubai museum and Dubai Creek (you can take Dhows to the Gold and Old Souk). Dubai is vast and access to the metro is a must. You'll be able to go almost anywhere on the metro including the Marina, Mall of the Emirates and the Burj Khalifa and Dubai Mall. The Metro is safe, clean, airconditioned and hits most of the places tourists come to see except the Burj Al Arab (however, you can go to the Mall of the Emiirates and take a taxi from there). When we arrived at 9:00 a.m. we were met by staff who were interested in helping us with our luggage and who gladly stored it as well as a concierge who explained all our options in terms of tours. Despite the fact that my friend was not even a guest and just there for the day, they gladly stored her luggage, printed out a boarding pass for her and helped her with a taxi to the airport. I was really impressed with the service through out my stay by all the staff at this hotel. The rooms are spacious and nicely appointed with a large well equipped bathroom. Wifi is available in the lobby and not the room which is the only downside to this otherwise great hotel with delightful staff

Reviews.Title: “Air conditioning poor in public areas; otherwise good”
Reviews.Author: eric2005
Reviews.Content: When I arrived (November 3, 2011) the air conditioning in the lobby was poor. The staff said that it was being repaired however by the 6th when I left it was about the same. For that reason I spent as little time as possible in the public areas. Room on arrival was very warm. Two technicians were sent up and they resolved the problem so air was fine in the room throughout the visit though not in public areas. Room was pleasant and in good condition. Food in restaurant was quite good. Indian chef from Calcutta was very pleasant and accommodating. Staff in general were polite and helpful. Hotel is within walking distance of the excellent metro. You can take the metro to the airport. Note: Skype is blocked in the UAE. If you have already downloaded the software, you can make Skype to Skype calls but you can not call phones (I found however that people could call from phones to me). Also Fridays are dry days in UAE.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure on the Location but good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hawker-Eye
Reviews.Content: Rooms are well appointment and as most hotels in Dubai really good beds. Hotel rooms are quiet. As mentioned by others there is an Irish bar which is good with live sport on. There is Free Wi Fi here to. Sadly they charge for it in your rooms. The gym and the pool are just a waste of time. Just not good enough. Breakfast is good provided you get there early enough. If I had a problem with it, it would be the outside street which I know is not the hotels fault but there are a lot of Ladies of the Night on the street which gets really annoying after a while. If you want some cheap Chinese then come out of the hotel and turn right and 3 mins walk and you can get a huge plate of food at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY SHERATON.....YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: MilanMarco
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately i went there in the end of AUGUST and the temperature you know was up in the sky....=) About the hotel, very nice and spacious lobby, very well trained staff (especially the hotel manager), nice buffet restaurant inside and a nice irish britshlike pub inside...=) Room was clean and very spacious, everything was totally well organized. n the morning there is a shuttle service to the resort on Jumeriah(you need to move by taxi or private car..don't try to walk under the sun believe me!!!) Everything was totally Sheraton, perfect and organized. Very cloise there is a shopping mall (i don-t remember the name)and some restaurants.......Wanna a tip? take the traditional boat that cross the river to rhe Deira area with the locals (they charge you a coin!!)...amazing...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but not the best location for vacationers”
Reviews.Author: kloudon
Reviews.Content: This room was very comfortable but the location is not too near the sites for people on vacation. The train is the best option, it is about 15 min walk to get there. Taxi's are not too expensive but everything is a distance. The food I had from room service was only mediocre, I did hear from others that the lunch buffet was good. There also were no real other restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for customer visit”
Reviews.Author: Sudhir2712
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sheraton bur dubai for 4 days and the overall the experience was good. the food was very good , the location is bit far away from main attraction. The breakfast buffet was excellent and will highly recommend for business visitors on short stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed, Terrible Location”
Reviews.Author: blueroose
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and although I didn't sleep well that night (no fault of the hotel), the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept on. The room was also super quiet, which I appreciate. The exec rooms are nice and clean and a good size with slick modern furnishings. However, the difference between outside and inside the hotel is like night and day. I walked outside to go to the ATM and absolutely felt like I stuck out. This is definitely in the "older" part of town. Could be shady at night, though Dubai raves an extremely low crime rate so there really is no need to worry. It's just worn down. The front desk staff were mediocre. As I was being checked in, a Russian gal asked the receptionist a question and he dropped everything to help her, which I didn't appreciate given I had just arrived after 30 hours of travel. The breakfast was average. Not impressive, but average. In the morning, I had to get the porter to hail a cab for me from the street, which took several minutes. The limo taxis that are parked in front of the hotel charge you twice as much. All-in-all a good experience and I would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: indie_traveller29
Reviews.Content: Average looking lobby. Better than expected rooms. Great location . They get stuck up on the service front as we were 6 couplesand had booked 2 months prior to the travel date and wanted rooms on the same floor but they spread us out over 2 floors. Even when we requested that we had bookings and were in a group the person at the reception( Kailash) did not help and his attitude was not the best. On ther other hand Mohan helped us during check out and was very helpful. If they up a level on the service front this would be the place i would stay everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing ....”
Reviews.Author: Sapphire786
Reviews.Content: Best accomdation in a while. Concierge was brilliant. Staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better than we expected! Stay here and save your $$ for shopping!”
Reviews.Author: RomeInJanuary
Reviews.Content: Not a fancy hotel, but nice rooms, comfortable beds, accommodating staff! The rooms were dimly lit which made it cozy...but somewhat challenging to read well. HOWEVER, that's not a deal breaker. The hotel is right next door to a great market where you can buy everything from fresh fruit to suitcases! An easy easy wall to a mall and a pick-up stop for the Big Bus Tour. BUT - I'd highly suggest NOT booking any tours in advance if you are staying here. Just show up and the concierge can arrange for a private car and a Guide for tours of Dubai, desert safaris and more! The cost is the same OR less than booking through tour operators and it's much better for those who wold like more flexibility with their schedule. We absolutely enjoyed our stay and will most definitely stay there again when we travel to Dubai. Stay here and save the extra money you'd pay for a fancy lobby....for shopping! We were two female travelers and felt completely at home here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good value, nice rooms, good pub, good gym”
Reviews.Author: 2deer
Reviews.Content: I often stay in this particular FPS. It is close to airport, good rooms, fast room service, good gym and pool, nice pub (though they could use an updated and expanded menu). Can walk to the mall or the train line - though in summer months, that will be a brutal daytime walk. Nice little grocery on backside of hotel for value on snacks, toiletries, etc.

Reviews.Title: “FPS deserves 5 stars for service”
Reviews.Author: KaranAsrani
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on our way back after our honeymoon. They had among the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on. Our room had an i-Pod dock alarm. The breakfast was nice - Indian, Chinese and Continental cuisines. Live counters for eggs. They kept the buffet open longer if you were at the restaurant. Didn't really get a chance to go to the other restaurant(s?) at the hotel. They had a pool but it was to hot for us to try out. The staff was very helpful in anything we needed - checking flight schedules, booking cabs, giving us directions to the train station and the malls. They have free wi-fi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Uh Oh”
Reviews.Author: busybee1751
Reviews.Content: Well my first impressions were wow, fantastic, I will come here again! However, connecting rooms were locked and it took quite a few conversations to get them unlocked. Then we had booked a room for 2 adults and another room for 3 children which needed an extra bed making up - boy that was tricky and when it was finally made up they made it in the wrong room. Eventually we were all settled when we noticed that the air conditioning was blowing iother people's smoke into our room!!??? So, unless they fix their air conditioning I will not be submitting myself or my children to a night of inhaling other people's smoke or come to that listening to them shout at each other all night. Pool looked good though!! A shame really because it all looked fabulous but when push came to shove it was faulty!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Beds”
Reviews.Author: dancingfeetManila
Reviews.Content: It is true what others say, the beds are fantastic ! They afford a good night rest after a jammed pack day of activities. The linens are of good quality. Though the lobby looks unassuming, the bed rooms looks very nice and welcoming, We were immediately offered fruit juices upon checking in 1 am, as the temperature outside hotel is around 40 C in the midnight ! I did not expect Dubai to be this hot.. Anyway, the location is great as it is a block"s walk from the Metro, also near the Metro is the Burjaman Mall, it got everything like brand name stores , etc, minus the swank and swagger of Dubai Mall & Mall of Emirates. They also gave us a late check out 2pm as our flight was late evening. Would return here if would have to drop in Dubai again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Anne A
Reviews.Content: Great and excellent Hotel!!!! The location is fantastic, staff was cheerful, friendly and willing to help in any way. Everything was just perfect. I will stay at Four points by Sheraton Bur Dubai again on all future trips to Dubai. I really enjoyed my stay! Thanks for everything! Also, a special thank you to all the staff at Four Points by Sheraton Bur Dubai I will absolutely return. Keep up the great work! FABULOUS!.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: MarieChristineFrance
Reviews.Content: Every thing was great...for the price, very good compared to other similar hotels. Spacious extremely clean rooms, beautiful decor and the included breakfast was also wonderful. Location was not perfect, but still close to major attractions and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Sujeee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on a business trip to Dubai. This place is very clean and had all the amenities that you require while on a business trip. Hotel staff is very friendly and went out of their way to ensure that you stay is comfortable. Price is very competitive and I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “FOUR POINTS BY SHERATON BUR DUBAI FANTASTIC STAFF”
Reviews.Author: alv77
Reviews.Content: We atayed here for 18 days over xmas & new year we have been to Dubai many times & have stayed in Deira over the other side of the creek in cheap hotels as we were going to be there over xmas we decided to upgrade im glad we did the hotel was great we had bed & breakfast package the breakfast was buffet style & there was lots of options a chef cooked omelettes & eggs near the buffet, morning courtesy newspapers were on a table by the dining area.Our room was lovely mini bar separate bathroom tv etc, it was cleaned daily to a very high standard,all parts of the hotel were spotless.The staff were very friendly & helpful. The metro (electric trams) were up & running which was an added bonus as the hotel was in a great location you can buy a card & keep topping it up.I must say Dubai has gone very expensive we went to the waterpark near Jumeriah it worked out about £40 each Extortionate god help if you had a couple of kids once inside you had to pay to lease a towel! Shopping in the malls isnt cheap either some things are dearer than here in u.k. Over the creek in Deira things are much cheaper there are a couple of resteraunts best food ive eaten has been inthe italian resteraunt in the AL KHALEEJ at the back of the mosque.You have to go & take a look around te gold souk amazing! beware of people selling fake handbags & watches around the gold souk. English style pub on top floor proper alcohol & daily specials,also good food, hairdressers called apple on the same floor & had my hair washed & blown did it great .Indian resteraunt too but didnt think much of the food preferred the one across the road.We went in the vegetarian resteraunt across the road from hotel forgot the name but its orange outside the food is 1st class we had to go back a couple of times yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Great city”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravcl
Reviews.Content: Great city...I love old part of Dubai for its people,character,food and TEA.....immerse yourself in this...... The hotel is a little far from main street but you can walk in the evenings or when its cooler and city is very safe....so it makes a great walk...we got a free upgrade of room and their rooms are very nice and big and clean. Staff are helpful.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: dipan2011
Reviews.Content: One of the best Stays I had, the fresh eggs prepared for breakfast, the wonderful array of Yoghurt at Breakfast and the very courteous staff made my mornings wonderful. It was a pleasure. I had the best sleep in this hotel, the beds are really good.

Reviews.Title: “Four Good Points !”
Reviews.Author: mehrdadnb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an example of a friendly business hotel . The location is good ( though I'm not a fan of bar Dubai neighborhood ) . The rooms are clean with contemporary design resembles that of 5 star hotels. Service was quite acceptable and fast. Staff very friendly and helpful. If I had to mention only one plus of this hotel It will be an " Absolute value for money " title. Really enjoyed , hope you enjoy too.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: KPSC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in Bur dubai in very close vicinity of malls, markets, metro, creek and airport almost everythin dubai has to offer. I booked thru their website and wen we went there they gave us pineapple juice which was excellent (sweet and cold-much required in dubai). the staff was helpful. we were given 1 fruit basket per room which we can order any day during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “loved it and would love to come back again”
Reviews.Author: Atif_Mullick
Reviews.Content: i ready a few bad reviews for this hotel on trip advisor which is why i was pleasantly surprised when i checked in the guy Charith who checked me inn was very hospitable and the room was pretty good and very clean. i did not get to eat at any of the restaurants but the breakfast was pretty good the ladies were very friendly and would jump to help with anything. The location is awesome its just 5 mins walk from the Metro station. The only problem is that when someone passes by your room you can actually hear the footsteps pretty clear so that's slightly disturbing but then again the hotel staff cannot help this. Over all i loved my stay i would definitely definitely stay here again if i visit dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Zeenat66
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel on 2 occasions once in December 2009 and December 2010. Both have been wonderful experiences, friendly staff great hospitality. This is a very convenient location the Metro is just a walk down the street, The very popular Burjuman Centre is also just a walk down the street. There is a great supermarket called Apsaara just downstairs. You dont need to take a taxi , you can get about very easily. The hotel offers shuttles to the beach, has a good breakfast buffet. The rooms have modern furnishings and make for a very pleasant stay.Lovely pool area too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic value for money for travelers seeking city tour”
Reviews.Author: adewski
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was the location. It was 2 blocks from the metro that can bring you to Dubai Mall and Jumeirah area. Eventhough taxi was cheap, the metro was quarter of the price. The food around the area is superb and very cheap. We went to a pakistani/arabian/indian restaurant (RAVI's) and was full after 2 euros per person. The room was fantastic and luxurious. We liked hanging out in our room since the bed was so so comfortable and sometimes it is too hot outside! I would recommend avoiding the breakfast buffet if you want to save a few bucks (200AED per day per room) since there is a "blue collar" grocery store next door where you can get fresh baked bread and pastries for only 4 AED. We did this every morning and ate in our room :) Swimming pool was unimpressive for being a hotel in Dubai, but they have a free great shuttle service everyday to the Jumeirah Beach Park so if you want to swim and tan, do it there! Tip: If you get this hotel, tell the taxi that it is the Four Points Sheraton on Bank street rather than the real street Khalid Bin Al Waleed street. Will save you the time and money from the taxi to drive around. Overall, it was a simple hotel with perfect location for the type of city traveling we did. Don't expect this to be one of those crazy luxurious Dubai hotels. If you are looking for grand, we recommend travelers to go for resorts in Jumeirah.

Reviews.Title: “Convinently located”
Reviews.Author: Ajags
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here in May 2011 and even earlier, It is centrally located and spacious as business and leisure hotel. This has been my first choice during my last few trips to Dubai. The rooms are nice and service is quick. It is my choice even for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, good location”
Reviews.Author: rajesh-boston
Reviews.Content: I've been there last November, good hotel but something less than the other Four Points in Dubai. Good location if you're a businessman, since the hotel is very close to the business district, 500m from metro station and shopping malls. Hotel is of an older style, although rooms are spotlessly clean and service is good. Swimming pool could do with renovation. Free internet only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Most Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: bluewren703
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night to a warm friendly welcome, given a glass of cold juice which went down very well. Given an upgrade which was a nice touch. Very happy with our room, spacious, nicely decorated and clean. The only one "small" problem was the lighting, particularly the bathroom, was really difficult to see, especially when applying makeup. Breakfast was very good, freshly squeezed orange juice was most enjoyable and we were well looked after by the staff. A special thank you to Victoria who very kindly got me a pot of ginger/honey/lemon tea as I was feeling unwell with a head cold. We found all the staff we encountered to be friendly, helpful and pleasant. I recommend this hotel and would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL VALUE”
Reviews.Author: HOTEL-CALIFORNIA-101
Reviews.Content: I have been to Dubai a number of times and as hotel prices have risen, I have moved to the lower cost non-branded hotels for example Ascot Hotel, Savoy Hotel etc. This time I tried booking via BA with whom I flew to Dubai. Actually, I was very surprised at some of the low rates, for what are very good hotels. This hotel for example was just $500 for 5 nights half board. Pretty impressive. The only extra was the internet, at a heavy $30 per 24 hours in the room. However, go down to the reception and it was free. So no problems there. The room was exceptionally well furnished with good quality furniture, bed etc. Bathroom had a very good shower. I was very happy with this hotel. Food was very good and much better than the less well known (non branded ) hotels that I have been staying in before. Service was excellent. And I would certainly go back if the rates were the same.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave03
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week. Although there was nothing fundamentally wrong with the hotel, I was very disappointed. Although the room was quite pleasant, it was dingy, probably due to the light bulbs all being "low voltage". Even with all the lights switched on, it was still dark. The bathroom was also very dingy, lit by three low output, low voltage bulbs! The shaving mirror, was meant to have a light in it, but the power cable had been cut at the fitting, so couldn't be switched on! To use the shower, you had to reach under the fixed ceiling shower head to switch it on, so were immediately drenched by cold water! The breakfast was a buffet affair, but selection was only average, so I stuck to cereals and fruit. The "English Bar" was ok (if you like the appearance of a typical 1980's UK pub). However, the food served was quite good. The hotel offers an airport transfer, but I struggled to get them to arrange this for 5.15 am. Instead they wanted to get me a taxi and asked me what I meant by the hotel transfer! I had to point out that they had a shuttle bus parked outside which had been used to collect me! As my company was paying the bill, why would I want to use a taxi I had to pay for? In it's favour, the hotel was only a short walk to the nearest metro station. Overall, an average hotel which was clean and tidy. However, would only recommend for short business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, clean. Lovely pool area on the rooftop”
Reviews.Author: chinze
Reviews.Content: Extremely clean rooms, the hugest bed I've ever seen! Lovely rooftop pool area. My one gripe would be the price of nibbles in the room and drinks. BEWARE - when you order a drink with your evening meal or around the pool YOU ARE CHARGED THROUGH THE NOSE!!! One small bottle of Heineken is 30 dirhams (almost £6 at today's exchange rate) and a standard can of coke is 16 dirhams (about £3). A packet of peanuts in the room (eat-now-pay-later notice in the room) is also 16 dirhams. You are asked for your credit card details at check in. Keep a tally of what you eat and drink. Reception staff tried to charge me 502 dirhams but when I questioned this she recalculated and found the bill should have been 207!! But not a word of apology from them. However, still a lovely hotel. Taxis are very cheap and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovesydneybest
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in this hotel. We arrived at 8am and our room was ready early. Staff were extremely helpful. We stayed in a standard room and it was lovely. There was an enormous bed with lovely sheets. The bathroom had a window overlooking the room which we liked. (It has a blind that can be shut if you want privacy.) There was also a desk, chaise lounge and small table. The lighting was all mood lighting. There were plenty of mirrors. We used taxi's to get around mostly. But there is a metro about 10 minutes walk down the road and a new one is being built even closer. The metro is lovely and clean - but only two lines are open. The location of the hotel is great for the silk souk. (twenty minutes walk). From the silk souk you can catch an "abra" boat across Dubai Creek to the spice spice souk and gold souk. The abra ride was one of the highlights of our trip. The hotel is about a 15 minute taxi ride from Dubai Mall, which is worth visiting. The governement taxi's are very cheap, but they drive rather fast. We tried to British pub in the hotel, and did not enjoy the many patrons smoking. The food was OK, but not great. We used the free internet in the lobby, and paid on one day for internet in the room - a bit pricey. There is not much else to eat around in the neighbourhood and we mostly found the best quality food at Dubai Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facilities and good service, but little attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: mako1
Reviews.Content: First off, I must say that although this is a Four Point hotel, it has the potential to easily become a five star property. To start off, I arrived at the hotel a bit before 8 pm. However, I did not find any member of the staff waiting outside to provide valet parking services if needed, to help carry the luggage, or to open the door. After reading some of the other reviews, it looks like they do not have any staff for this function in the evening, but only have them during the day. The lobby is somewhat dated, at least for Dubai's standards; however, I was greeted by two very friendly receptionists. Check-in was very fast, but I was asked if I wanted a non-smoking room, and when I replied in the affirmative, I was asked if a room with two single beds would be fine. I said that that would not be ideal, and so was then given a room with a king sized bed. The room was an executive room, and was very nice, yet somewhat impractical. To start off, the desk was very nice, while the chair and the couch there were very comfortable. There was also a plasma TV with around forty channels, with a relatively diversified channel selection. Internet was available for a fee that is written somewhere on their website, but is free in the lobby which I thought was a nice touch. The window was right behind the bed, and there was no significant view. The bed was also comfortable, but there was no choice of pillows, and they were all too soft for my liking. The main issue I had with the room was the soundproofing. As I was walking down the corridor to my room, I could hear what people were saying inside their rooms, and from inside my room, I could hear whenever someone closed their door. Also, at around midnight, the desert air, mixed with sand started blowing, and the sound was as if someone was taking a shower right next to me. Moreover, in terms of noise, the air conditioning was the main culprit, with sounds alternating from your regular clanking to a sound more similar to that of a helicopter. As I was trying to sleep around midnight, I did not call to complain since I did not think that the hotel could do anything about that, especially since I had to try and get as much sleep as I possibly could, and could not lose time on changing rooms or waiting for repairs to occur. There were further minor issues that I felt really harmed the overall quality of my stay at the hotel, and that could have easily been remedied with a bit more attention from the staff or the management. For instance, only one pen was supplied along with a very small notepad, while the pen turned out to be broken. No slippers were supplied, although I think that you have to ask for them, but just having them in the room would not hurt. The alarm clock next to the bed had the wrong time, and I could not understand how to adjust it, so I just unplugged it and requested a wake-up call from the staff who were more than happy to comply. The safety deposit box was placed in a location where one has to sit on the floor to be able to use it which is very impractical. Finally, only one 0.5 Liter water bottle was supplied, along with coffee/tea making facilities for two mugs. The water bottle barely sufficed, but what I felt was most ironic was that there was a tag on the bottle that said that "of course it is free at the Four Points." If that bottle is not enough, you can always get an Evian from the minibar for around five dollars (of course that is not free, even at the Four Points). I think that it would have been better to just include two water bottles, especially since a bottle in Dubai barely costs a quarter of a dollar. However, one positive note is that an iron and ironing board were included in the room. The room service menu looked like it had been printed off a computer in black and white, and then photocopied. The food prices were very reasonable, the lasagna for example, cost around $13, but I did not get a chance to try the food. Now onto to the bathroom. The bathroom was very spacious, with a plethora of mirrors. There is a glass pane between the shower and the room that can be closed with a curtain. The portions of the amenities were very generous and I thought were of a good quality. The shower head was very nice, and can be seen in one of the attached photos, but the knob was not very good and came off from its place when I was trying to turn on the water. I also felt that the bath towels were too small, and should have been of a better quality. The hairdryer was not too great, and one has to hold the button to keep it going, in addition to not being very powerful. The breakfast was very good, the service there was great, and the selection of food was more than adequate. In addition to a buffet, there is a live station where a chef can make omelets for you. In my opinion, the best part about the breakfast was the orange juice. However, although they had pancakes and other cooked/baked options, I feel that it would have been better to also keep these at the live cooking station. Also, it would have been helpful to have labels for all the food just in case someone did not know what they were, although I am sure that the staff would have been more than happy to help if they had been asked. I did not use to the fitness center or the pool, but both were very small. Check-out was very quick. I was only asked if I had taken anything from the minibar, and did not have to wait for them to check as they do in other Dubai hotels. The concierge was also helpful, but he did not have any information as to which stores can be found in a certain mall. In conclusion, although the overall facilities at this hotel were not great, the rooms were very nice as were the staff. However, a few minor changes as well as a bit more care from the staff can easily push this hotel into the five star category, however, the hotel's rates seem to be somewhat affordable. I have attached some pictures of the hotel that I took, while the ones on the hotel website portray the rooms very well. If you have any questions, I would be happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, if you are a Starwood Club Member.”
Reviews.Author: Gopalkhetan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights .Hotel is close to Metro and Super market. Hotel has different service for preferred guests ( Members, Westerners ) and for guest booking through agents.Fruit baskets are of two type-ordinary, and deluxe. I was refused a choice ,and was told, that the deluxe is reserved for preferred guests only. No welcome drinks, for ordinary booking guests either. Internet in room is very expensive, In this age, it should be made cheaper or complimentary. Room Size, was good,Bathroom was good,everything else about the Hotel was Ok. We paid $140 a night .

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Disco nights if you want to sleep, Location-run down area”
Reviews.Author: chrisSurrey
Reviews.Content: Booked as a one night stopover in Dubai with Emerates airline. Arrived on an overnight flight and went to hotel which offered a 24hr checking. A room was available on our arrival but on the first floor, we requested a high floor to avoid noise, we were offered a higher floor but this was a smoking room it was declined on inspecting. Our first floor room was clean and tidy and modern. We had an early departure the next day (5.30am) so went to bed early, then the disco started up and seemed to be above our room, rang reception to complain as they knew from our checking we were concerned about noise. was told that the disco went on to 2pm (which it did). Its a pity as apart from the location we found the waiting staff (apart from the reception) very helpful. A very bad experience made worse from indifferent response from reception.when we rang them about the noise and when we checked out in the morning. Not a good experience and i can only suggest that if you must stay here make sure your on a high floor and that no disco is planned.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in a very Average Area”
Reviews.Author: Jesterinoz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in early January after someone recommended the hotel and recommended I stay in Bur Dubai. Found the check in staff less than helpful, arrived around midday only to be told I couldn't check until 2pm, which was fair enough and they took the copy of my passport and other details. Come back at 1.50pm and I am told I couldn't check in yet. Sit there for ten minutes and no one comes or goes, then spot on 2pm I am able to check in and keys materialise (room had been ready for sometime). To top it off they lost my photocopy and check in details, so had to repeat that process. I had one of the nicer rooms, paying about US$300 a night and it was a nice room, with fairly modern decor. The common areas and the building itself if fairly run down. Service was good for breakfast and they had a pretty good buffet. Worst thing about this hotel is that it is in a rundown commercial area. There is no shopping here and wouldn't wander too far from the hotel. The metro line is about 5-10mins walk away. Wouldn't return here and not to a Four Points standard.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Attitude & Very Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: JumaXXXAlmarri
Reviews.Content: Rude staff ,,, means one of the worst hotels in Dubai. The security people are very rude, they keep asking and investigating when you want to go to any of the outlets there. The management on the other side does not attend your complaint or come back with a feedback. I raised up an incident to the GM about the assistant security manager who was rude and aggressive but no feedback I have received, I left my member card with him but he doesn’t care to return it back and apologize for what happened. Simply they don’t show any respect for who comes to spend at the hotel. Many hotels available on the same road, one of these hotels is Towers Rotana with a better rates as well.

Reviews.Title: “Older style property centrally located”
Reviews.Author: sheddie70
Reviews.Content: Located in heart of bur dubai, 500m from metro station. Good access by metro to airport (6/7 stations) and shopping malls and attractions along Sjeik Zayed road. Hotel is of an older style, although rooms are spotlessly clean and service is excellent. Bathroom/sleeping accommodation is no longer modern. Swimming pool could do with renovation. This is not one of the gleaming modern hótels of dubai bit is celan and well-located. Free internet only in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: japete
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights for New year. On arrival was told that we couldnt get into our room as the travel agency we booked with hadnt booked us in so after travelling over night for about 10hrs we were not amused (taken this up with said travel co,). Ended up sleeping on sunbeds by pool then someone came after a couple of hours to say there was a room for us which was very much appreciated. Stayed on a half board basis which was reasonable but most nights we were the only two eating. The food, although looked nice, was often cold and the choice of only steak or fish three nights of the week a bit boring, though I must say the fillet steak I had was excellent. They made an effort on NYE by providing party hats and poppers and decorating the bar and restaurant which was a nice touch. Breakfast was ok once you managed to get in. The restaurant is definitely too small for a full hotel. One morning we were told to sit in the coffee bar and we would be served from there. Unfortunately we had to fetch everything ourselves which meant carring hot drinks through the corrider from the restaurant to the coffee bar. We also found that they didnt seem to understand us very well. A number of times we asked questions and couldnt get any sort of proper answer.Just a blank look. The pool area on the 1st floor hardly saw any sun so we caught the free shuttle to the beach. It cost 5 dirhams each to enter the beach and then 45 dirhams to hire the sun bed and brolley.We also had a disagreement with the staff at the hotel as whether or not we could have towels for the beach. The front desk and concierge said we could fetch 2 pool towels but the pool attendant said no. We ended up taking towels from our room. Three days running we had to ring housekeeping for bath towels because the cleaner didnt leave us any and then for some reason the day before we left there was no toilet roll left either!!!! The location isnt too bad with a supermarket not far and pharmacy if needed. Theres a sportswear outlet across the road and also the Burjaman shopping center down to the left on the opposite side of the road. We didnt do any sight seeing as we have been to Dubai before and done the touristy things. So I suppose the hotel was ok for a relaxing break.. It suits a business traveller more than a tourist. Would try other hotels before returning to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms in central Bur Dubai”
Reviews.Author: thatsgreatforme
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I was given a twin room which was 2 single beds which was really bad for me. My onward flight was 12 hours after my check out and they kindly gave me a room to change on the executive floor which was similar to mine but with the luxury of a double bed. The staff were reasonably good and the English pub was good but smokey. The room was very nice but the cost for internet usage over 4 days was incredible. By far the most expensive internet room charge I have ever seen. If my company weren't paying there is no way I would have even considered it. I remember looking at it thinking I must have the exchange rate wrong, but no. There was free wireless in the lobby, but that made me think why can it be free downstairs and £20 a day upstairs. Paying for internet in a 'business friendly' hotel is a joke nowadays. I wouldn't stay here again unless it was free on principle.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: spottster
Reviews.Content: We spent a relaxing stay in Dubai over x-Mas and New Year. This time we choose a hotel in proximity to the center. Good choice. The hotel is well located, clean with spacious rooms, and especially to be mentioned - has very friendly staff, especially the bell boy who answered our daily questions... Breakfast was great and we enjoyed it still after a 2 weeks stay. Also the shuttle bus to the malls and to the Jumeirah Beach was a very welcome service. May be the schedule to the beach could have been different, who wants to stay at the beach until 5.30...? Based on our experience we would stay again in this hotel and can recommend it for an easy and comfortable stay in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff service - not hotel for additional needs guests.”
Reviews.Author: happyholidayer30
Reviews.Content: Hotel on busy road with easy access to the metro with supermarket next door. Room was a good size with a wonderful mattress on the bed. In fact it's the best mattress we have sleep on in Dubai. All of the hotel staff we meet were very polite and most helpful and are a credit to the hotel. The bathroom has everything you need. However the room lighting is very poor leaving the room generally quite dark. The hotel windows do not open. So if you like fresh air instead of air conditioning this may not suit you. If you are wheelchair dependant and can down walk a few steps the restaurant is up three steps and there is two steps up to the pool. The front entrance has three high steps up to the entrance with a ramp that is of no use for a wheelchair. If you haven't pre paid for breakfast unfortunately the restaurant staff will constantly remind you to pay even before you have finished you breakfast. Pool was in the shade all day and for the duration of our trip 6 nights. Good sports bar.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hous2ngal
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights due to a stop over for my flight back to USA. Decided on this hotel due to its location near the train station- which is connected to almost all of Dubai as well as Meena Bazaar. The Khalid Bin Waleed Station( take a left as you exit the hotel) and Meena Bazaar( take a right as you exit) is 5 minutes away. Taxis are easily available anytime during the day. When i checked in, i was offered a glass of juice which was refreshing. I also got a free upgrade which was an added bonus. The rooms were very clean and the beds were also comfortable. Staff was very helpful and ready to answer any queries. I plan to be in Dubai in December and will definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good standard but rather bad location”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points Bur Dubai last may for 3 nights and were quite satisfied by the standard it offers. Four Points hotels are managed by Starwood and are always a good option, whether on business or leisure. They are typical 4 star accommodation, providing a similar high level of service and luxury as for instance Sheraton hotels, but are slightly cheaper with less extravagance and less attention to detail. The hotel is located in Bur Dubai district which is, in my opinion, the least interesting part of Dubai. There is nothing special in the area and it’s quite far to the main attractions as well as business quarters and office buildings. This was not a huge problem, though, as we rented a car. Appearance from outside is not anything special however rooms and public parts of the hotel (i.e. lobby, restaurant) justify a 4 star ranking. Staff is very service- minded and helpful, rooms were spacy and comfortable, if a bid dark even at day- time. The pool on the roof was lovely and offered a nice view of the area. Breakfast was tasty and fresh and included in the price. I loved Dubai which is a perfect example on how a city can develop and would certainly return to the Four Points Bur Dubai hotel.

Reviews.Title: “no regrets!”
Reviews.Author: phatdaz
Reviews.Content: A friend referred me to this hotel and was glad i followed his advice. Joined the SPG too, and stayed for the Eid Hols. The staff was very friendly and ready to answer any question given by the guests or anyone popping in really. The room was just as shown in the pictures, and was kept clean as a whistle! After a long day/night out, it was good to come to a room so clean. Only small issue i had was with the tub/shower glass 'door,' needs to be better fitted to not allow water to escape. Didn't try out the pool...well cause i don't swim and i wasn't there that much to make use of it! lol Only had Breakfast one day there, and it was damn good too! Just right to start the day, but i did use a lot of room service and the food was quite good,(gotta try out their Club Sandwich!). The location is great, Bur Juman Mall right down the road, quite a few restaurants on all 3 sides of the hotel. The concierge was great in getting a taxi whenever i needed it. Plus the free Wi-Fi down in the lobby was brilliant! Also the rate i got for the room was unbelievable! Next time i'm in town i'll be staying there for sure!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and satisfying !”
Reviews.Author: stpl99
Reviews.Content: my wife and me stayed in your hotel for 3 nights,and were really happy as the atmosphere was very peaceful,the rooms being recently renovated had a trendy feel to it.cleanliness and utility wise the room was perfect and surely we shall come again to be your guests !

Reviews.Title: “Out the way from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: Karl-c63
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the Bur Dubai area, free Wi-Fi in the lobby and bar. A good sized gym also well equipped. Rooms have a wired internet connection in but cost 100DHS for 24 hours. (The exchange rate I got made it about 17 GBP) The pool area is located on the roof and is of a good size. Hotel staff where friendly and welcoming. Cannot comment on the restaurant as the time we visited was Ramadan. (Was open during daylight hours) I would happily stay at this hotel again if what I required was around downtown Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: PetrNovak
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my two friends during August 2010. We arrived approximately at 3 am and we were immediately welcomed with a glass of apple juice and acommodated to our two rooms. We were assigned to room 614 with a huge window and a magnificent view to the Burj Khalifa! This is exactly what i love! In the room we also found comfortable beds, necessary air conditioning, a minibar with quite expensive (non)alcoholic drinks, a sofa, work table and a fully-equpited bathroom with the same view to the Burj Khalifa! At the hotel there were also several restaurants, a pool with deckchairs and jacuzzi, gym and a massage studio. Just next to the hotel there was a supermarket with a great selection of grocery and drug-store stuff. But what I loved most about the hotel was it's friendly staff. They all have made an excellence job during my stay and even when I needed help at 3 am they were ready to help. Management of Sheraton should be proud of Mr. Krishna, the man who was cleaning our rooms (unfortunately I dont know his name) and their colleagues! The only quite minor critism I've got, is related to the internet access. You have to pay for it and if you want to surf free, you have to go to the hotel lobby. The connection is also quite unstable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for Business and Leisure”
Reviews.Author: meonthenet
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place and city for a useful place and trip. This hotel has all the required facility that we look for a wonderful value for money trip. This hotel scores very high on my list. Can be recommended for a wonderful staying experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Four Points by Sheraton Bur Dubai”
Reviews.Author: rbsimmo
Reviews.Content: On arrival in 40ºC heat we were met with a fresh icy cold glass of apple juice which was very welcoming. We were upgraded free of charge to and Executive room on the 6th floor also which was wonderful. The room had a king size bed and a huge bathroom with a window that looked out to the bedroom. It cost me $756.00 Dirham for 3 nights online direct with the hotel. The room had a large plasma TV a mini bar and wireless internet in the room for a fee as well as a lounge and work desk. But they do have free wireless internet in the lobby. The beds were excellent and of very high standard. Staff were excellent and spoke very good English. Restaurants nearby and café’s. Also walking distance to Dubai Museum which is a must see. Only cost $3 dirham entry. Train station is a 5 minute easy walk and costs $8 dirham per person and takes about 10-15minutes to reach The Mall of the Emirates depending on stops. Another must do is “At the Top” at Burj Khalifa. It cost us only $100.00 dirham each. We purchased these on the day and were able to go up immediately. A Taxi from the airport cost us $50.00 dirham including a tip and from the hotel to the airport only cost us $20.00 including tips. If you want to be in the heart of Dubai near The Mall of Emirates and Burj Khalifa this may not be the place for you as you need to catch public transport to the city, but if you want to be in the heart of “ Old” Dubai and mix with locals and traditions this place is definitely the best to stay at. We could not fault them except they should offer free wi-fi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly frugal”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchman06
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed at all Four Points hotels in Dubai, and this location does have some advantages. First, they have a gifted masseur at their Health Club. Second, the location is very convenient, right next door to a supermarket with a wide selection of food and non-food items. Handy for essential if your luggage's lost (like mine was). The hotel interior is rather aged, although my room was nice. Wi-Fi internet is free in the lobby, and about 25 dollars a day in your room. But for that money, it's unfortunately not even reliable or lightning quick. The unfortunate thing is the rather odd 'water policy' of this hotel. It's this hotel's policy to provide every room with ONE 500 ml bottle of drinking water EACH DAY. Heaven forbid you ask for one more. You practically have to beg - or pay the always ludicrous mini-bar fee (5 bucks for a small bottle of Evian). Have never encountered this policy in any hotel I have ever stayed anywhere in the world. And I'm sure I will never again encounter this policy in this particular establishment, as I will take my business elsewhere. Now, you might wonder "why the fuss over a simple bottle of water?" and that's exactly the attitude I would expect from a customer friendly hotel. In short, there is no good reason to stay at this hotel - not only are they not the nicest nor cheapest of the Dubai Four Points, but they turned out to be the stingiest.

Reviews.Title: “Just about ok”
Reviews.Author: Uday27
Reviews.Content: Rooms are ok and clean , location is good , service is also ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, clean and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: skonnur
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal from four points and had a comfortable stay for 3 nights. The rooms are not very spacious but well laid out, well furnished, clean and comfortable room. The best thing about this hotel is its location very convenient to reach from all over dubai and more importantly if you are taking a bus from Abu Dhabi as the Bur Dubai Al Ghubaiba bus stand is close.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trustworthty
Reviews.Content: The Hotel rooms are very much upto a FIve star category providing a great room product and in room amenities and facilities. Recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a central location,immaculate, homely and friendly service

Reviews.Title: “Not impress”
Reviews.Author: orchid050
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for three night. We arrived in the afternoon, there was no attendant by the door. My husband went inside, to request somebody to bring our luggage from the taxi while I waited outside in the heat. We thought breakfast was included but hotel said otherwise, can't blame the hotel for this only our agent. We were tired went to our 1st floor room 106, waited for our luggage half an hour later rang reception, to enquire about luggage. They told us will send it straightaway, half an hour gone by still no sign, we could not go anywhere so we went down to get our luggage, it was still in the lobby. We brought our luggage, while we were doing it they came forward, I said don't bother we will manage it ourselves because we already waited for an hour. What a an appalling customer care & service. This was our fourth trip in Bur Dubai i have never came across such bad service in Dubai before. We have stayed in Ascot htl last time for 12 days, the minute you arrive they open the door for you take care of your luggage make you feel special. I wanted to try different htl not again & never Four point. The htl have Ballrooms there was a party on thursday we heard nothing heave a sigh of relief. On friday, the function were in both ballroom the noise of music was horrendous till early hour. We were leaving in the morning I was grateful I don't think we will ever consider this htl again. We choose Bur Dubai for its location near meena bazzar.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated rooms, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: PandaHouston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points Bur Dubai for 2 nights in March 2010. We found the room newly renovated and it was clean and roomy. The bathroom is very functional. Not too big but not too small. It is surrounded by glass and mirrors. One of the walls between the bathroom and the room is made of glass with wood blinds opened and closed from the outside so it is best to share the room with someone whom you know very well! The decoration in the room is very sleek and contemporary. The hotel was very convenient for us. It is less than a 10 minute walk to the metro which is clean, efficient and cheap. Taxis can be expensive if you use them for full day travel. Not all metro stations were open and not all attractions can be reached via metro. We combined the metro with taxis. Right outside the hotel (turn left as you exit) is a supermarket which also has a bakery and a small stall if you are interested in a small breakfast. There is also a street stand near the hotel that sells excellent chicken schwarma (turn right as you exit). We bought some and took them to our room to eat. From the airport to the hotel, it cost us 50 AED to travel by taxi. There is free wireless internet access in the lobby. It was fast and convenient. Would definitely stay here again if visiting Dubai for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Accessible location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: RandomGrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a week or so in early March, 2010. We had an executive room on the 7th floor which was kept impeccably clean for the whole tenure of our stay. We didn't hear any noise from the traffic nor hotel restaurants, either. The view wasn't anything to write home about but then again, you're not paying a premium for it either. There was a free wired Internet connection available at the room but not wireless, which would've been convenient for checking out email and weather with phone. The breakfast buffet was decent enough and never felt crowded. Perhaps a bit pricey, but it saves you from a headache to try and find a place to dine if you're an early riser. A supermarket can be found just a few steps to the left and it's open from 08 until Midnight, excluding Fridays when they close for three hours between 11-14. You might opt for getting your breakfast items from there, too. Room service meal portions were very generous, in our case two meals would've been enough for three. Whether the location is good, depends on your interests. Textile souk was close-by, as was the abra station to cross the Creek to Gold and Spice souks. Burjuman is the closest mall and it is situated next to the Khalid Bin Al Waleed metro station. You can use Metro to access Dubai Mall and Mall of the Emirates for even more extensive shopping. If you'd prefer to spend all days tanning and swimming, this might not be the perfect choice for a hotel. Having said that, you can use the hotel's free shuttle service to go to Jumeirah Beach Park. Admission to the beach is 5 dirhams and if you want to rent out sunbeds, umbrellas or towels they're available for 15, 10 and 5 AED, respectively. Of course, you can choose to stay at the hotel pool although it's quite small. They provide you with towels and there's a small gym as well. We had a late departure so we had a full day to us after check-out. Storing the luggage at the hotel and using their poolside showers and saunas was no trouble at all in the evening.
